summary: This document is an email chain from January 2020 among U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) personnel discussing travel approval and logistics for an interview in Stockholm, Sweden, related to the Epstein investigation (2018R01618). The emails also reference several prior domestic travel requests for victim interviews in Los Angeles and West Palm Beach in 2019.

persons.name: Unknown
persons.role: U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) Legal Assistant, Public Corruption
persons.context: The sender of an email providing hotel search results and recommendations for the Stockholm trip, noting the need for approval to book over per diem.

events.title: Planned Interview in Stockholm
events.description: The SDNY team requests travel approval for an interview near Stockholm, Sweden, scheduled for January 29th and/or 30th, 2020, as part of the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Interview in Los Angeles
events.description: Prior travel request for an interview (or interviews) in Los Angeles on December 16 and/or 17, 2019, in connection with the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Interview in Los Angeles
events.description: Prior travel request for an interview in Los Angeles on November 14, 2019, in connection with the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Interview in West Palm Beach
events.description: Prior travel request for an interview in West Palm Beach on November 4, 2019, involving two SDNY team members.

events.title: Victim Interview in Los Angeles
events.description: Prior travel request for a victim interview in Los Angeles, tentatively scheduled for a Wednesday-Friday timeframe in June 2019.

events.title: Meetings and Interviews in West Palm Beach
events.description: Prior travel request for approximately three days of meetings and interviews in West Palm Beach, Florida, in late May 2019.

events.title: Meetings and Interviews in West Palm Beach
events.description: Prior travel request for approximately three days of meetings and interviews in West Palm Beach, Florida, in early April 2019, explicitly for United States v. Epstein.

events.title: Meetings and Interviews in Florida
events.description: Initial travel request for two days of meetings and interviews in West Palm Beach and/or Fort Lauderdale, Florida, in March 2019, for the Epstein investigation.

keyFacts: The SDNY investigation into Epstein (case 2018R01618) was actively conducting victim interviews and other investigative steps in multiple locations (Sweden, Los Angeles, Florida) as late as January 2020.
Travel for the Stockholm interview involved coordination with the FBI's Legal Attach√© (Legat) and the U.S. Embassy for potential hotel bookings.
The email chain reveals bureaucratic frustrations with the government's travel booking system (E2), citing incorrect hotel locations and inflated prices compared to commercial sites.
Multiple SDNY team members are involved, but their names are redacted in the document; the correspondence is between AUSAs and legal/administrative staff.
The investigation involved securing hotel conference rooms for interviews, indicating formal, recorded proceedings with victims or witnesses.
